page.title: 20The Wreck off Sheerness
page.content: The{wreck}of the American Liberty ship, the Richard Montgomery, containing unexploded bombs, lies in the Thames Estuary just to the north of Sheerness. Built in 1943 in Florida it dragged its anchorage and sank on the Nore Sands on the 20th August 1944 during a storm. The sands broke the back of the{ship}snapping the hull in half. Next day only the tips of the masts were showing. Its contents were 3691 U.S.tons of aerial fragmentation bombs for use in{World War 2.} Today the ship's masts are still visible from Sheerness and it remains a constant hazard to the thousands of merchant ships which{transport}goods along the Thames. It is thought that if the bombs were to explode the town of Sheerness would be destroyed.
